name: Gina's Shrimp Scampi with Angel Hair Pasta
headline: Gina's Shrimp Scampi with Angel Hair Pasta

author.name: Patrick and Gina Neely : Food Network

keywords: Easy Pasta Recipes,Easy,Pasta Recipes,Easy Shrimp Recipes,Shellfish Recipes,Shrimp,Easy Main Dish,Main Dish,Italian,Low Sodium
recipeIngredient: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined

recipeInstructions.text: Add the pasta to a large pot of boiling salted water, over medium heat, and cook until al dente.

Meanwhile, heat a large 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil. Once shimmering and hot, add the shrimp and saute until just cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Remove to a plate and reserve. Add the garlic and red pepper flakes to the skillet, then saute for until the garlic is fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the lemon juice and white wine and raise the heat to high. Let the liquid reduce for 2 to 3 minutes. Whisk in the butter, add a ladleful of the pasta cooking water and return the shrimp. Remove from the heat.

Drain the pasta in a colander, and add it to the skillet along with the chopped parsley and toss. Add the lemon zest and adjust the seasonings with salt and pepper, to taste. Transfer to a serving platter and serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: Great flavor but too much pasta. It absorbs all the sauce making it too dry. Would use half the amount next time.
Loved the subtle heat, super easy. I personally would have added a touch more lemon, but delish overall.
Was good added ramen noddles since out of angel hair and was like an Asian/Italian fusion.
Wonderfully simple version of scampi. Had everything except the parsley, but didn’t miss it. Love the bit of heat from the red pepper flakes. Will make again.
This is a family favorite over and over again !!! Easy and delicious!!!
Absolutely delicious. Made this exact recipe several times. Thank you!
Made this a lot easy and delicious recipe!!
Easy to make and a new family favorite.
I love this recipe but the one thing I would change well not necessarily change but I would take the tells off of the peeled and deveined shrimp
This has become an easy work-night go-to recipe for me.   Incredibly delicious and satisfying with a glass of white wine and a green salad.
Best shrip scampi I've ever had!
One pound is too much pasta for this recipe

I’ve made this recipe three times already in the last month. I added squash. zucchini, spinach, and sun-dried tomatoes to it. I love a dish that I can put all the good stuff in and make it a one-pot hit! I made it once using salmon instead of shrimp and I’ve also used both protein angel hair pasta and chickpea pasta and both were delicious in the recipe. I’ll definitely keep this dish in rotation.
This is my go-to weeknight 30 minute meal. The red pepper flakes give it a nice little kick. Family favorite!
Easy to make and delicious.
Less pasta and more white wine. I added an Italian dressing packet for more flavor.

I found and cooked this dish tonight. I forgot to take out meat for dinner. One of the easiest protein to quick thaw is shrimp. I typed in "easy shrimp scampi" and Viola! First thing that popped up. My family loved it. It was easy, directions were very clear. I had everything I needed. Except fresh parsley, so substituted for dried. I also added Fresh chopped asparagus and finely diced sun dried tomatoes @ the olive oil and garlic stage. I also added a couple of large handfuls of fresh spinach just before serving. The only reason I added the extras was to use up a little of this and that I had to use up. This recipe is perfect for that. You could even use chicken if that's what you have on hand. The exact same flavors would work with it too. Will definitely be making this again. Thanks for the recipe 😁
So delicious, flavorful & easy!!
Great recipe! If you like garlic and red pepper flakes, don’t be scared to add more. I did add a little more wine since, as one should always have more wine.
The food is fantastic

It was great!
Next time, per personal taste, I'll cut back on the lemon juice a bit. This is SO good!

It was great! I followed the directions to a T and it was so good! I think next time I will add more shrimp and sauce. Thanks for sharing! 
ButtaBae
Delicious. I made extra sauce as recommended by other reviewers. Can’t wait to make it again.
Delicious!
Excellent

Next time, we will use half the pasta! Or add more water or white wine.
But one pound of pasta is a lot of pasta!
this lookes good
Easy peasy and deliciously fresh
Love this recipe!  My non-shrimp eater ate the noodles with chicken instead and was quite delightfully pleased.  Another keeper!

Great quick recipe, but like others I a felt it was a bit dry.  So, I doubled the butter, wine and lemon and halved the red pepper flakes for a little less spice.

Definitely will add this to our meal rotation!
Was delicious easy to put together and make.
This is an amazing recipe. I made it for my sister and I and it was devoured. I did add more wine and pasta water as one of the other reviewer stated. Definitely a must eat.
Having read the other reviews, I added more pasta water and wine to ensure there was enough sauce.  It came out perfectly!  Loved it!

I am 83 years old, Italian, and had never cooked shrimp scampi.  This recipe is fabulous.  I made some modifications because of particular tastes of 2 children.  Only used 1 lemon and scant pepper flakes.  Used 4 lbs med. sized shrimp and 2 lbs angel hair pasta.  Also added some capers & a little caper brine and the 3 adults and 2 kids also sprinkled some parmesan cheese.  When I make it again I will quadruple the sauce.  I had very little (which flavored the pasta well enough that there were no leftovers), but they all kept asking for more sauce.  The kids also added red pepper flakes so next time I will also add more.  Finally, I want to say that you can teach an old Italian new tricks because this recipe will be used a lot more.  Thank you.
It's pretty good, there are good flavors. For me it was kinda dry, but that's personal preference. It was easy to make and came out really good.
Super easy and DELICIOUS!!
It came great ! I loved the flavor!
Everyone in the family enjoyed this one!
A little to much red pepper for me, I added peppers and onions! Really plain sauce I’d prefer something a little more garlic buttery ! Idk missing something!!!!

This was REALLY good.  Our family of 4 all enjoyed it.   The lemon zest added just the right tang (I think we ended up using a whole (organic from Trader Joe's) lemon's zest as opposed to half), and to spare the kids the spice, we only added about 1/8 tsp. of the red chili flakes.  I'm printing it up to put the recipe into our regular rotation!  If there were any left over, I'd eat it for breakfast....  ;)
Pretty good!
Overall underwhelming and not as flavorful as I would have hoped. Next time I will use less pasta so the sauce is more flavorful on the angel hair.
Easy and quick to make and very tasty!
No flavor. Was good after I used a quarter of the amount of pasta and doubled the amount of sauce.
Perfect amount of sauce and flavor.
Great!!
Oh it is so good ! I will be using it again and again I added Lobster as well with the shrimp.  FANTASTIC

I have been making this exact recipe for years, it has been on regular rotation and is now a family staple. I personally prefer a lot of garlic so I always sauté the shrimp in garlic before setting them aside, sometimes we prefer linguini instead of angel hair, and lately we always top with Asiago, but other than that I follow the recipe exactly and it is always great!
Love, Love,Love
Delicious! Super fast and easy for a week night meal.
The sauce amount is perfect for 1/2 lb pasta which is plenty for 2 people
This was the BEST! This was scrumptious!! I didn’t add the wine to the recipe. Instead I added more pasta water broth. Wine was served with the meal. Great for any meal or festivity.
Fantastic recipe! We always enjoy, plus I share with a few people that also loved.The only two things changed was the amount of red pepper ( less ) and I use vermicelli pasta.
Great recipe! The red pepper flakes add just the right amount of heat.
This was amazing!  Added green onions and Parmesan cheese...yummy!

My family loved this meal. Yes, I made slight adjustments after reading the reviews. Changes....doubled amount of shrimps- see this as non-optional with the amount of pasta used. Used an entire stick of butter plus 1 tbsp. Added 1 each: red bell and green bell peppers, doubled garlic. And, doubled white wine. Still barely had enough liquid. Will need to decide best way to increase next time. I bought some Argentina sweet shrimp...mmmmmm! I do not want to take away from the basic foundation of the original recipe because it is good. I just amped it up....I cannot remember a time when I did not play around with a recipe. Have fun cooking....thank you for helping me feed my family!
A quick meal that is delicious and easy!!!
Light and delicious after a hard days work
Love this recipe.  Added diced red and yellow peppers and green onions with a touch of Old Bay.  Used 8oz. pasta for one lb. of shrimp.
I added old bay to my shrimp. Also added green, red and yellow bell peppers to give it some eye appeal. Very good. Will make this again soon.

Trash. Either use stock rather than white wine or use about half of what is listed in the recipe.  Also use half (8oz) of pasta rather than the whole 16oz.  16oz is WAYYY too much. Also recommend using more butter since you're already using 5 tbsp of butter and adding shredded parmesan.  The recipe also says to cook the shrimp, cook the garlic, butter, and reduce wine WHILE you're cooking the angel hair pasta? Uhhh. Angel hair cooks in 2-3 minutes al dente. You trippin.  I recommend dropping the pasta when you begin to reduce your sauce.  You will thank me.  

tl;dr: good recipe, trash instruction.  Follow mine.  
One love.
A great go-to for group dinners. I add Old Bay. Always a crowd pleaser.
Pretty good recipe.
Very yummy and easy to make
Love this recipe! My first time making shrimp pasta and my husband loves it! Easy to make.

I agree that 8 oz. of pasta is plenty. I'd just go ahead and put a whole stick of butter in, too. What's 3 tbsps more, right? I didn't have any white wine but chicken broth worked just fine. My whole family loved this recipe!
I found that 1 pound of pasta is WAY too much for this recipe. In the future, I would cut the pasta in half and try to increase the amount of sauce (especially the garlic).
Fabulous!!
This is the best! Have made it several times and it always turns out great! I have a friend who loves it so much she eats leftovers for breakfast.
Enjoying you recipes -
going to try this recipe, looks easy enough... just wish they would talk in their normal voice, hard to listen to, squeaky and all.

This recipe is delicious and fool proof!  When I don't have white wine, I substitute vegetable broth and sometimes top with chopped green onions...Very fresh and full of flavor.  Love the Neely's recipes, they never let me down!

I followed the recipe and made a few changes. I added sauté spinach from homemade shrimp stock. Instead of 5 tablespoons of butter, I used 4 tablespoons. I also used the remaining shrimp stock in the pasta water. I also increased the garlic (6 cloves)and salt & pepper the shrimp before hitting the pan. Delish!!!!!

I loved it!  After reading the commends about being too blend,  I added a little bit of garlic salt as I was so-frying the shrimps.  I also used marsala wine instead of dry wine because I didn't have it on hand.  If you want more juice, I suggest increasing the ingredients quantity.  It was easy,  fast and delicious!

I followed the advice of the other reviewers and increased the seasonings as follows. For 1lb of pasta I used 2lbs medium shrimp, 10 cloves of garlic (1 large head), 1 tbsp red pepper, 1/2 bunch Italian parsley, 1 cup white wine, 2 juiced lemons & zest, and 1 stick of butter. The pasta water was well salted, and I used about a cup. It was not too spicy and even my 8yo gobbled it up!
Tasteless and bland. Not a good recipe a

This recipe is the BOMB!  I found it online and made it within minutes for a couple of  friends who stopped by unannounced on a Tuesday night.  Simple, quick and divine!   It will be a go-to recipe whenever I entertain with friends.
My family loved it,  I made as listed with the exception of bow tie pasta. Anyone know the calories per serving?
This is a quick, easy, and delicious meal!! My whole family loved it! That doesn't happen very often.

This was a wonderful summer dish that my husband and I really enjoyed!  We jazzed it up by adding red and yellow peppers and heart of palms which in our opinion perfected the dish.  We will definitely make this again!!
People please, think and taste while you cook.  Of course you should add more seasoning while cooking this or any other dish for the matter and always, always add more garlic.

Let's back up, I made Shrimp Scampi many times and you can eliminate the white wine and only use half of a lemon. Remember that the pasta absorbs some of the sauce so you may want to make double. Buon appetito. .
My daughter loves it!

Unless I did something wrong this was a scrumptious recipe and, I have done this before on my own with out following a recipe, and i loved this recipe and so do my kids!!! I do agree you don't need a whole pound of pasta but i did find out that if you combined and a big enough pot then it works because then its not too much sauce and its just right and the next day OMG!!!!!!!!! DEFINITELY NOT A BLAND DISH!!!!!!

The volume of scampi "sauce" that it makes is no where near what it needs to be for a pound of angel hair! Made this recipe exactly as called for and found that it had no flavor, the volume of pasta was overwhelming. 1 juiced lemon, 1/2 cup of white wine and 5 tablespoons of butter may be enough for 1/4 lb of angel hair. (oh there is a ladle of pasta water...still like throwing a cup of water on a bonfire of pasta!) if you love eating bland angel hair with an occasional shrimp...this recipe is perfect for you! go for it.
Amazing recipe.Most scampies are bland and have no flavor whatsoever,but this shrimp scampi is not anywhere near bland or flavorless.It is tangy with a little bit of heat that I love.
I have tried a few scampi dishes but this I thought was off the hook and I will be serving it tonight at the restaurant where I am a chef. thank you Gina great dish!
Way, way, way too lemony (unless you really like lemon). My family didn't care too much for this dish, but if I chose to remake again, definitely going to either omit or lessen the amount of lemon.
This pasta was so good and easy to make. Everyone loved it!
D-LISH! Perfect dish....light but most important....tasty! :p
delicious!  would totally make again!  the lemon juice and zest really brighten up the flavor.  I added some grape tomatoes (sliced) in to the mix too, great flavor, great color!
It was easy and tasty!!!  My son and I made it together!!  (He's 11!)  WE both loved it and paired it with Garlic butter biscuits!!

Excellent! Nice and lemony/quick and easy! For those who think too little sauce, too much pasta.......Scampi sauce SHOULD JUST dress the pasta, [like dressing on a salad], NOT swimming in it! AND....... in case you all have not read a pasta box recently, there is NO POUND of pasta anymore......most are 13.25. And if you disagree with me, go check out Martha Stewart....hers is essentially the same, and probably LESS sauce as well! This was perfect!
great taste, but there was so little sauce!  I was embarrassed to serve it - even with less pasta (as others suggested)  I would double or triple the sauce next time.

Tasty, But Use Less Pasta.......made this last night, but I would use 1/2 a  16 oz box of DeCecco Angel Hair Pasta.  1 Lb was too much pasta. I loved the sauce and so did my husband who is usually sensitive to a lot of lemon.  Would make this again!

video.name: The Neelys Make Shrimp Scampi
video.description: Pat and Gina Neely work together to make Shrimp Scampi With Angel Hair Pasta, making it an easy one-dish meal.
